===Origin into the [[Pre-Cataclysmic Age]]===
The Darkholders started out as [[Thulsa Doom (Earth-616)|Thulsa Doom]]'s followers. After Doom's death at the hands of [[Kull (Earth-616)|Kull]], they used the [[Darkhold]] to create the first [[vampire]], [[Varnae (Earth-616)|Varnae]].{{citation}} Varnae turned some members into vampires.{{citation}} Other vampires were [[Nosferatu (Earth-616)|Nosferatu]], [[Verdelet (Earth-616)|Verdelet]], [[Saracen (Vampire) (Earth-616)|Saracen]], [[Maracen (Earth-616)|Maracen]], and [[Boy (Vampire) (Earth-616)|Boy]].{{r|Vampires: The Marvel Undead #1|; [[Vampires]]' entry, History section}}<!-- uncomplete ref --><!-- unclear who is Darkholder, Ancient, or both -->

Some of the first vampires,{{r|Marvel Zombies Handbook #1|; [[Vampires]]' entry, History section}} such as Boy, Maracen, Saracen,{{r|Blade: Vampire Hunter #1}} Verdelet,{{r|Vampires: The Marvel Undead #1|; [[Verdelet (Earth-616)|Verdelet]]'s entry}} and presumably Lamia became known as the [[Ancient (Vampires) (Earth-616)|Ancient]].{{r|Marvel Zombies Handbook #1|; [[Vampires]]' entry, History section}} ''It is unknown whether all or any of those were themselves Darkholders.''

Surviving Darkholders managed to make off with the [[Darkhold]] before Atlantis sank.{{r|Bizarre Adventures #33}}

===[[Modern Age]]===
The Darkholders resurfaced.<!-- general statement --> Led by [[Randolph DeGuzman (Earth-616)|DeGuzman]], they secured a temporary alliance with [[Lilith (Earth-616)|Lilith]], despite the opposition of other leaders (Lilith herself kept an open perspective on the use of the cult for her own purposes).<!-- {{r|Darkhold: Pages from the Book of Sins #1}} -->

Under Lilith's instructions, they attacked [[Victoria Montesi (Earth-616)|Victoria Montesi]], who was a reluctant heir to the Montesi responsibility of safeguarding the Darkhold, and seen by Lilith as a threat to it. As the assassins failed to kill Montesi, they were given to Lilith, who had the [[Lilin]] [[Doc (Lilin) (Earth-616)|Doc]] reshape them to be faster and stronger. Their next attack on the "[[Darkhold Redeemers (Earth-616)|Darkhold Redeemers]]" (joined by [[Johnathon Blaze (Earth-616)|John Blaze]] and the [[Daniel Ketch (Earth-616)|Ghost Rider (Dan Ketch)]]) was repelled as well.{{r|Darkhold: Pages from the Book of Sins #1}}<!-- 

Meanwhile, the [[Darkhold Dwarf (Earth-616)|Darkhold Dwarf]] appeared in various locations, offering "guidance" to people receiving pages of the Darkhold by letter.{{r|Darkhold: Pages from the Book of Sins #1}}{{r|Darkhold: Pages from the Book of Sins #2}} -->

After Lilith's defeat, the Darkholders sent hitmen to [[Washington, D.C.|Washington]] to kill the Darkhold Redeemers (somehow knowing they were going there).{{r|Darkhold: Pages from the Book of Sins #2}}<!-- 

... apparently decimated during in Darkhold: Pages from the Book of Sins -->

====The Red Slayer====
They later took interest in [[Cletus Kasady (Earth-616)|Carnage]]. [[Barry Gleason (Earth-616)|Barry Gleason]] orchestrated Cletus Kasady's meeting with them. It was later revealed that he was planned as a sacrifice to awaken [[Chthon (Earth-616)|Chthon]], based on the prophecy in the Darkhold that stated ''"When the Red Slayer spills blood on sacred stone, he who sleeps shall wake and what walked will walk once again."''{{r|Carnage Vol 2 4}}<!-- 

to be completed -->

Lovecraft]]'s "The Call of Cthulhu".
